message.p: This is a simple multi-user chat client and server.

For simplicity, server and client all run in the same process, and therefore it is ideal for a deployment using wthttpd, when running all clients in the same process. (Because all I/O is asynchroneous, this probably could easily support thousands of simultaneous users as well).

The client is contained in a widget (SimpleChatWidget), and can be instantiated as many times as you like, even in the same application.
Because of the widget abstraction, it is straight forward to include a chat client in your own application, by linking both the client and server classes into your application.

The implementation uses server-initiated updates, a feature that is still under development in Wt. When a message is received, the user interface (i.e. widget tree) not only of the current session, but also of all other clients is updated simultaneously, as part of handling the event.
